_header: The worthiest thing most of goodness
Note: For other MSS which lack the Introductory section see 2205
_description: The Lay Folks’ Mass Book, translated from the French original (c. 1150) — 629 lines in couplets

OxfCCC155.First Lines:
The worthyest thynge þe maste of gudnesIn all þe werlde
                    þan is the mes…
OxfCCC155.Last Lines:
…ffor of all thinges in þis werlde is þe mesThe
                    worthyest and maste of gudnes
OxfCCC155.Editions:
Simmons,  Thomas Frederick. 
             The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS
         o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968.

CULGg531.First Lines:
Þe worthieste thyng mast of gudnesIn þis worlde þan
                    es þe messe…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
…If þou make it here in letterÞou may chaunce it
                    fore bettere
CULGg531.Editions:
Gerould,  G. G. 
             “The Lay-Folks Mass-Book from MS Gg.V.31, Cambridge University
                Library.” 
             Englische Studien
         33 (1904): 1-27: 17.

CamGon84.First Lines:
A Worthy þyng moste of godnesseIn all þe world hit is
                    þe messe…
CamGon84.Last Lines:
…Pater noster aue Mary & CredeGod send vs to owre
                    mede
CamGon84.Editions:
Simmons,  Thomas Frederick. 
             The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS
         o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968.

CamNewn4.First Lines:
man or woman þat wol lereAmasse deuouly for to
                    here…
CamNewn4.Last Lines:
…And that hey holi god he queyte the thi medeOf whom we spek
                    of when we say oure crede
CamNewn4.Note: 358 lines, with the substitution of a new Prologue
CamNewn4.Editions:
Simmons,  Thomas Frederick. 
             The Lay Folks’ Mass Book.
EETS
         o.s. 71 (1879); repr. 1968.

BLAdd36523.First Lines:
The best þing and moost of godenesseIn alle þe worlde it
                    is þe messe…
BLAdd36523.Last Lines:
…And to reioye myn heritageBought with ȝoure bloode in
                    tendre age

BLRoy17Bxvii.First Lines:
Þo worthyest þing most of godnesseIn al þis [w]orld
                    is þo messe…
BLRoy17Bxvii.Last Lines:
…For of alle in þis world þen is þo
                    messeÞo worthiest þing most of gud nesse
BLRoy17Bxvii.Editions:

NLS1931.First Lines:
The worthyest thyng most of gudnesIn all þo worde þat is
                    þo masse…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…þo holy goste þat is on hyghtSende hus grace to
                    leue ryght
